entry.def: If you avenge a wrong or harmful act, you hurt or punish the person who is responsible for it.

example.ex: He has devoted the past five years to avenging his daughter's death...
example.tran: 他过去5年一心报丧女之仇。

example.ex: She had decided to avenge herself and all the other women he had abused.
example.tran: 她决定为自己和所有其他被他侮辱的女性报仇。

auth_sentence.content: The dark, grim avenger was replaced by a lighter, slightly humorous figure in stories that belonged more in the detective genre.
auth_sentence.res_content: The dark, grim avenger was replaced by a lighter, slightly humorous figure in stories that belonged more in the detective genre.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The dark, grim avenger was replaced by a lighter, slightly humorous figure in stories that belonged more in the detective genre.

auth_sentence.content: It had become advantageous in France, as elsewhere, to be seen as an avenger of capitalism.
auth_sentence.res_content: It had become advantageous in France, as elsewhere, to be seen as an avenger of capitalism.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It had become advantageous in France, as elsewhere, to be seen as an avenger of capitalism.

auth_sentence.content: Harry Thaw raised his arm high above his head, letting the barrel droop - a Florentine avenger who had done his duty.
auth_sentence.res_content: Harry Thaw raised his arm high above his head, letting the barrel droop - a Florentine avenger who had done his duty.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Harry Thaw raised his arm high above his head, letting the barrel droop - a Florentine avenger who had done his duty.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 复仇心重的, [利于]报复的
stems_affixes.word_buile: venge惩罚[引申为报仇]+ful充满……的→充满惩罚的心→复仇心重的
revenge[n.报复,复仇 v.替…报仇]+ful充满……的→adj.报复的,深藏仇恨的
re反+venge惩罚[引申为报仇]→反惩罚→报仇
venge惩罚[引申为报仇]+ance表名词→n.报复,报仇,复仇
a加强动作+venge惩罚[引申为报仇]→v.为…复仇,为…报仇
re反+venge惩罚[引申为报仇]→反惩罚→报仇
